intro: Ichnanthus lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and thrives in partial to full shade. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in late spring to early summer. Ichnanthus lancifolius is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
